alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL COUNTY THROUGH 345 PM MDT... At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ribera, or 16 miles southwest of Las Vegas, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Las Vegas, Romeroville, Tecolote, Ribera, Chapelle, Sena, San Agustin, Ojitos Frios and Los Montoyas. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 321 and 347. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 8. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
